author: ccadminteam
title: Catalyst Circle - Funding Mechanism
description: Le financement de Project Catalyst nécessite plusieurs mois avant que les fonds soient disponibles. Les initiatives critiques ont besoin d'un financement plus rapide.

f6_assessments.q0: Cette proposition semble correspondre parfaitement au défi du mécanisme de financement rapide, puisqu'elle prévoit qu'une partie du financement de Catalyst soit distribuée à des initiatives qui sont essentielles pour le Cercle Catalyst. Comme nous l'avons vu, le Catalyst Circle v1 a eu du mal à mener à bien certaines initiatives car il dépendait du bénévolat de certains de ses membres et aussi de membres de la communauté. Cette proposition allouera suffisamment de fonds pour résoudre certains des problèmes ressentis par le Catalyst Circle, même si son budget ne sera pas suffisant pour financer des problèmes plus importants, comme la création d'un modèle de réputation pour Catalyst, mais il vaut mieux commencer petit et évoluer. L'impact de cette proposition en tant que semence pour le financement de futures initiatives de gouvernance peut être énorme si elle est mise en œuvre avec succès, car elle peut s'étendre très facilement si la communauté y voit de la valeur. Peut-être même que le budget de 7 000 $ par "groupe" est suffisant pour payer l'exécution de plus d'un projet, en fonction de la taille des projets.
f6_assessments.q1: L'équipe qui propose ce projet est composée d'un membre du Cercle Catalyst et de l'équipe administrative. Ces deux équipes sont très engagées et capables de mener à bien ce projet, puisqu'elles mènent respectivement l'initiative de gouvernance et le suivi de ce qui est fait, et elles sont les mieux placées pour le faire. Même s'il n'y a pas de feuille de route dans la proposition, de par sa nature, elle n'est pas nécessaire et les étapes du soutien financier rapide du Cercle des catalyseurs sont clairement détaillées et appropriées pour atteindre les objectifs de la proposition. Le risque de ne pas trouver de bons projets pour résoudre les problèmes soulevés, ou de ne pas utiliser tout le budget, est bien discuté et il est proposé de mettre les fonds de côté pour de futures initiatives du Cercle, ce qui semble tout à fait approprié. De plus, la proposition prévoit un budget pour les coûts imprévus, ce qui est important lorsque l'on tente quelque chose pour la première fois, car cette initiative prendra probablement plus de temps que prévu. L'équipe de proposition laisse également de la place pour ajuster la feuille de route et le plan en fonction de l'évolution de Catalyst, ce qui est crucial puisque la plupart des choses dans Catalyst changent constamment. Enfin, les membres de l'équipe d'administration responsables de l'audit des propositions travaillent déjà sur d'autres audits et initiatives open source dans la communauté, ce qui me fait croire que l'argent sera dépensé de manière équitable et transparente.
f6_assessments.q2: Il existe un plan clair sur la façon d'exécuter la proposition, même si une feuille de route n'est pas présentée de manière habituelle, il est possible de comprendre comment cette proposition va être mise en œuvre et puisque tout va être enregistré dans un environnement open source (CC GitBook), il est tout à fait possible pour la communauté de suivre ce qui est fait et de suivre les progrès. Les KPI de succès de la proposition ne sont pas non plus explicites, mais ils sont mentionnés dans le texte, ce serait le nombre de projets financés avec cette trésorerie, qui est actuellement de 1 par groupe, mais plus pourrait être atteint.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great proposal to give each group in the catalyst circle $7000 in funds to chose one problem and then build a team to solve it. These groups are already out there looking at the pressing problems in their areas and it makes sense to delegate a small amount of funds to them to solve problems. The only question I have is, is the amount too small? But we can always build on that next round.
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst Circle team is highly experience and connected within the community. They have presented a detailed plan and there is no reason to think they can't deliver on it. This is a great project from a team that is committed to the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is well written and has clear deliverables and metrics for auditing and measuring success.

f6_assessments.q0:
In the proposal, the formulation of the problem (section "problem statement") identifies with precision the meat of the problem of the entire "Rapid Funding Mechanism" campaign: the problem is bigger that the money.  The problem is time.  And time is in function of the necessary (yes, necessary) hurdles to conclude: a) the proposal submitted for Rapid Funding corresponds to a real need in the community b) the proposal can effectively address that need.  

The proposal has experienced people in charge and the Catalyst Circle is a trusted body in Cardano's governance structure.  Its ideas evaluation technique (described in the proposal) is a process curated by many iterations in the Cardano Governance environment.  Potentially that technique can be a great contribution to a bigger problem:  we need an effcient methodology for discovering and processing ideas, in less time and with fewer obstacles. And of course, with less risk, because  It's not a secret that discovering truly effective ideas is a business with a low probability of success (and that fact is a reality beyond the control of humans, include the Catalyst Circle).   However, it is an unavoidable job for any organization seeking to evolve.

Basically, I think the proposal says: "let's give the guys their funding. They know what they are doing."  Meanwhile, how to detect, evaluate and fund ideas with real impact potential, with a minimum amount of obstacles but with the maximum possible risk reduction, yet screams for a solution.  

Perhaps the solution to the Rapid funding problem lies beyond the Catalyst Circle itself. Perhaps we need deeper integration of the Catalyst Circle's expertise and experience into the overall operation of proposal funding across the Catalyst Project. And perhaps endowing the Catalyst Circle with its own funds may mean alienating a body that can change for the better the way proposals are evaluated and funded across the hole Catalyst Project.  

I believe that the Catalyst Circle is precisely one of the places where an efficient methodology for processing ideas can emerge.  

So, perhaps the funds are needed not to find a Rapid Funding Mechanism, they are needed for the evolution of the Catalyst Circle itself, which in its transition could teach to the hole ecosystem a better way to evaluate and select proposals.
f6_assessments.q1:
-  In terms of funding, of course, they will be safe with them. But it seems to me that the implementation of the proposal corresponds to the evolution of the Catalyst Circle itself and not precisely to the search for a Rapid  Funding Mechanism.  However, the Catalyst Circle is a governance tool in our quest for governance independence.  Therefore, the exercise of providing funding to the Circle does not deviate from the needs of the Cardano ecosystem.  We need the Catalyst Circle to evolve as a decision-making body.

- As with the many other proposals submitted at F7, provide information about the proponents and their work. Likewise, external links to that information.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the proposal KPIs depend on the KPIs of the proposals that the Circle would fund, please provide more clarity on your own KPIs.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal offers a rapid funding mechanisms specifically tuned to emerging problems in Catalyst as identified by the Catalyst circle. Catalyst improvements are one area where rapid funding could be very beneficial.
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst Circle is evolving rapidly and is clearly committed to improving the Catalyst process. The proposed funding mechanism uses a similar framework to Catalyst and requires little in the way of technical development. The Circle should have no trouble running this experiment.
f6_assessments.q2: The Circle's role revolves around communication with the community so we can expect that the successes and failures  of the initiative will be thoroughly discussed.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solution enables targeted rapid funding deployment by the Catalyst Circle - a diverse, trusted and experienced group of community members outside of standard funding rounds. It would enable members to fund mission-critical and time-sensitive solutions faster than the standard process and aligns well with the challenge problem. As a pilot mechanism to distribute funds to time-critical community initiatives, the project offers to identify processes and protocols that could be scaled to other groups quickly and positively impact the entirety of the cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is made up of the most experienced catalyst  team members voted in by the community which points to a high likelihood of project success. The problem sensing process, as well as the proposal submission, assessment and review protocols are very well designed to accommodate for rapid and time-sensitive proposals. The budget is fine, it is important that the circle has funds on hand to tackle pressing issues that arrise. The rollover of funds is an appropriate tool to allow for future fund reallocation. Would suggest that the funding pool for each group allocation not be limited to one project only to allow for more flexibility in the allocation of funds.
f6_assessments.q2: A weekly update on the use of project funds and administrative and governance processes from the Catalyst Circle and admin team at Project Catalyst Town Halls will ensure community accountability and transparency.

f6_assessments.q0: This is exactly the type of proposal soght by the brief. Increasing the speed of funding is critically important to allow important projects to move rapidly from volunteers to paid professionals. While volunteerism is strong in our community (and a strength), the ability to pay people for their time will accelerate and dramatically improve the time and energy people will be able to devote to Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: These are some of the very best of the Cardano community, they have the competence and a long history of delivering value to the community. They are publically accountable and can rally additional resources at will.
f6_assessments.q2:
Success is described, KPIs, milestones, action plans, roadmap are aligned, 
specific, measurable, publically auditable, and time fenced, therefore the information is sufficient to audit success and progress towards it.

f6_assessments.q0: Excellent proposal. I will respectfully try to make some recommendations. The proposal meets the objectives of the challenge and meets the criteria of impact, feasibility and auditability.
f6_assessments.q1:
I believe that success is guaranteed, the support of the community will be the measure of the success of the proposal.
It is very interesting that there is a budget since according to the roadmap in some cases it may mean a part-time job or more. I think you have to give it an institutional framework with assigned roles and responsibilities. It would be important that when the term ends, a management report should be presented to the new members. Perhaps the new team approves the management of the previous ones, granting some type of bonus as an incentive to good management.
f6_assessments.q2:
I think there should be a way to audit the auditors, who controls the auditor, the community? or the new CC members.

Greetings

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great idea. The project can help speed up the disbursement process as well as solve the urgent needs of the community. The mechanism of action is clear. (Rating given : 5)
f6_assessments.q1: Project progress clearly presented. The project is continuously improved and developed. No specific time has been given for the roadmap. However, the time limit for CAs to evaluate proposals is rather short. (rating given :4)
f6_assessments.q2: The budget breakdown is obvious. Since catalyst circle version 2 is based on version 1, the possibility of success is quite high. (Rating given: 4)

solution: Fournir au Cercle des catalyseurs élu une réserve de fonds pour des mises en œuvre axées sur les solutions aux problèmes énoncés par la communauté.
experience: Les membres du cercle Catalyst jouent un rôle essentiel pour faire de Catalyst le plus grand fonds d'innovation décentralisé au monde.
